page.title: 08Danny House
page.content: Danny House is situated in an estate of 1486 acres. The earliest evidence of the name Danny is in the 13th century when William de Warenne gave Simon de Pierpoint a grant to enclose "the wood at Danghite." The mansion is of Elizabethan and Queen Anne{architecture.}Most dates from 1582 and the south side from 1728. It is E_shaped and built mostly of brick. In the Great War the house became a military hospital and a meeting place for{heads of state.}There, on 13th October 1918, Lloyd_George, Winston Churchill and others prepared terms for the armistice with Germany. Danny House and estate had been in the Campion family for centuries but now they provide accomodation for elderly folk.
